intro: Gynochthodes glomerata, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Gynochthodes glomerata is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils.
